abstracts.cdata!:
The project would comprise (i) the
            expansion of substations, including additions to transformer
            capacity, switchgear, and voltage control equipment, (ii)
            the increase in transmission capacity in Upper Sind through
            the addition of a second circuit to the 132 Kv line from
            Dharki to Rohri and (iii) the rehabilitation of existing
            substation transformers. The total cost of the project is
            estimated at US$40 million which would represent
            approximately 15 percent of WAPDA's investment
            requirements over the next five years for secondary
            transmission and distribution.
